pageTitle: North Carolina State Grange. A Directory of the Granges in North Carolina, 1877.

The text has been encoded using the recommendations for Level 4 of the TEI in Libraries Guidelines.         Original grammar, punctuation, and spelling have been preserved. Encountered typographical errors have been preserved, and appear in red type.         Any hyphens occurring in line breaks have been removed, and the trailing part of a word has been joined to the preceding line.         All quotation marks, em dashes and ampersand have been transcribed as entity references.         All double right and left quotation marks are encoded as " and " respectively.         All single right and left quotation marks are encoded as ' and ' respectively.         All em dashes are encoded as --         Indentation in lines has not been preserved.         Spell-check and verification made against printed text using Author/Editor (SoftQuad) and Microsoft Word spell check programs., 5992=Library of Congress Subject Headings, 24th edition, 2001, 3412=Text transcribed by Apex Data Services, Inc. textBeforeTable: Page 3 GRANGES ARRANGED BY COUNTIES.          ALAMANCE. 12th Deputy District.--To be supplied. 11th Deputy District.--To be supplied 10th Deputy District.--W. P. Reinhardt, Hickory, Catawba county. 9th Deputy District.--T. H. Robinson, Concord, Cabarrus county. 8th Deputy District.--W. B. Clement, Jerusalem, Davie county. 7th Deputy District.--Dr. D. A. Montgomery, Company Shops, Alamance county. 6th Deputy District.--Frank M. Pitt, Oakville, Warren county. 5th Deputy District.--L. L. Polk, Raleigh, Wake county. 4th Deputy District.--Hill E. King, Stump Sound, Onslow county. 3rd Deputy District.--B. F. Hooks, Goldsboro', Wayne county. 2nd Deputy District.--John A. Davis, Tarboro', Edgecombe county. 1st Deputy District.--Wm. B. Shaw, Indian Town, Currituck county. List of Deputies:          J. E. Porter, . . . . . Ex-Officio Secretary. W. H. Cheek, . . . . . Warrenton. L. L. Polk, . . . . . Raleigh. G. Z. French, . . . . . Wilmington. S. B. Alexander, . . . . . Ex-Officio Chairman. Executive Committee:          STATE BUSINESS AGENT.--Dr. D. W. C. Benbow, Greensboro'. LADY ASST. STEWARD.--Mrs. H. E. King, Stump Sound, Onslow county. FLORA.--Miss Eugenia Robinson, Concord, Cabarrus county. POMONA.--Mrs. N. B. Whitfield, La Grange, Lenoir county. CERES.--Mrs. S. B. Alexander, Charlotte, Mecklenburg county. GATE KEEPER.--W. D. Wharton, Greensboro', Guilford county. SECRETARY.--Joseph E. Porter, Tarboro', Edgecombe
